website_summaries.verdict: 9" tall durable metal push up bars that will last a lifetime.
pros: Made from durable metal that will not rust or break
Anti-slip feet keep athletes safe during workouts
Coated with a shiny silver finish
Foam padding on handles for added comfort
cons: These bars are heavier than others and do not disassemble for travel or storage

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I got these to use for push ups and tricep dips and they work great. My son is also using them to work on some of his gymnastics drills. They are sturdy and lightweight. My only complaint is that the screws are a little hard to to get all the way tightened.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wyler

customer_reviews.title: Not the best quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had these for just shy of two weeks. I am @ 275 pounds, and do between 200-250 push ups per day. I got these bars to help alleviate wrist pain. They worked good for @ four days. The set screws that hold the handles to the base will not stay tight, causing the bars to slide and "go crooked" while doing push ups. I would not reccomend this product if you are planning on doing alot of push ups.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy
customer_reviews.text: When I started using these I was 190lbs and they felt sturdy and plenty strong enough for what I was doing. They held my full weight while doing hand stand push-ups. One thing I liked about the design has been commented on in other reviews as being bad: With the bolts fully tightened, the feet on these will shift if enough pressure is applied. I like this because if you fall over while doing a hand stand, they'll give just enough so they won't break. That said, your mileage may vary. Given the choice to go back on buying these? I would make the same decision and get them. Absolutely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Well built, good price
customer_reviews.text: I've only had these for 1 day, but so far, it was money well spent. They are only 9" tall, but I'm not a very big person anyway (5'6", ~130lbs) so they're the perfect size for me. Theyre also seem to be very sturdy for me, so I don't feel like they're going to give out when I've got my full weight on them. The price definitely doesn't hurt either, especially compared to the others that cost $70+.
customer_reviews.author: md256

customer_reviews.title: They are great for handstand pushups and planches plus obvious l- sit
customer_reviews.text: They are great for handstand pushups and planches plus obvious l- sit, pushups, and dips I weigh about 175 and there's no give can definitely handle more weight easily and for the price just can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Parallettes
customer_reviews.text: The minute I received it I set it up and started working out. It is high enough above the ground to do parallel training for the abdominal area. It stays still in the ground and has a handle to grip. The price is WAY less than other similar products and functions the same. Overall, highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Abo

customer_reviews.title: They’re fine
customer_reviews.text: These parallets are nothing special but do the job, simple easy construction, relatively stable enough for light duty, probably wouldn’t use them if I were going to a more advanced stage. Given the reasonable price and overall good utility I’d say not bad, can use them and be happy.
customer_reviews.author: EL

customer_reviews.title: interesting and fun workout.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap in price but not in quality. I was worried about them being to small, but they are quite adequate. Incredibly simple to put together and you can take them anywhere for a quick, interesting and fun workout.
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: YES!  WORTH IT!
customer_reviews.text: This was effortless to assemble and the diversity of training you get out of something so simple is ridiculous. The foam bad it comes with are the perfect size. Very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Really Solid Parallelettes
customer_reviews.text: Really solid beginner parallelette bars. For the price of equipment these days, you can't beat this price. Would recommend for beginners and for folks under the 180 weight range. Great for the price point, sturdy, easy to put together and use.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Davis

customer_reviews.title: Comes with NO screws...
customer_reviews.text: The product is quite decent for the price, and the hight of these bars is perfect for me to do all kinds of push ups. What was frustrating is that it came with ZERO screws!! Thank God I am handy and have a box of screws in my closet. I put it together and I like it, but how was I supposed to assemble it?
customer_reviews.author: Anna Shilova

customer_reviews.title: Allows me to do dips at home
customer_reviews.text: Been trying to get into calisthenics recently with all of the Gym closures and this was my first purchase for trying it out. works fine, im 235lbs and im able to use it without worry of it falling apart on me.
customer_reviews.author: drewski10

customer_reviews.title: You've Been Warned
customer_reviews.text: Garbage. One of them had a really sloppy weld that prevented it from being put together properly. Ended up returning them and getting the Frank Medrano series Lebert paralettes. These j/fits are like a child's toy compared to those. Save yourself the time, spend a bit extra and look at getting the Lebert's instead.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Rochniak

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Addition to My Home Gym
customer_reviews.text: When I don't feel like a full workout, push-ups, pull-ups, and dips can blast my upper body. This device allows for two of the three exercises. I am very pleased with the cost and quality of my Jfit Bar.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Bishop Jr

customer_reviews.title: Excellent overall
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 11 inch version because I saw that it had 2 screws per side that stabilizes the structure, unlike the 9 inch version. Sure enough, it's very sturdy, and it provides excellent range of motion for handstand push ups. The only issue I see (although it does not impact the performance AT ALL) is that if you screw in the screws a little bit wrong, the base will not be perpendicular to the handle. But, this really doesn't matter unless you have OCD.
customer_reviews.author: 5Pack

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Got these more as parallettes than push-up bars. They work great, my balance is improving, as well as my shoulder strength, arm strength. They have a wider base which makes them sturdy, but are super lightweight so they are easy to move around.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: Too thin
customer_reviews.text: It's pretty sturdy after years of use. The problem is that the bar is too thin and it hurts your hands. The foam is garbage, rip that off immediately.
customer_reviews.author: W. W

customer_reviews.title: I like these bars because they're over-sized and extend up from ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these bars because they're over-sized and extend up from the ground farther than most. This allows me to dip down below the bars when doing a pushup more, so I can work on my chest muscles better. The only complaint I have is that no matter how tight you try to get the connection when assembling them, they tend to become misaligned. This doesn't really affect the performance but it's slightly annoying as they don't feel as solid as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Horace Christopherson

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Just make sure you tighten up the screws really well and it should be good to go very comfortable in the hands definitely does the job the only difference is a 9 or 11 in you choose which one you want depending on what you going to do
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Top Notch on the Market
customer_reviews.text: These are the best, this is my second pair of push up bars. My first pair from a different brand I did not enjoy, since they were not made very durable for the amount of usage I was aiming for.........But these are great and they provide me with a greater range of motion. Can't believe I waited 3 months to purchase them
customer_reviews.author: BG A.

customer_reviews.title: The workout bars
customer_reviews.text: I love the bars they came at a great time I would recommend them to anyone who is working out at home
customer_reviews.author: Mistrish

customer_reviews.title: They work
customer_reviews.text: They work for what I wanted them for, they were easy to put together but loosen really easy and the legs get crooked. It's annoying more than anything.
customer_reviews.author: Jana L. Parker

customer_reviews.title: Just seems like a cheap job
customer_reviews.text: Defective. One of the vertical members of the feet was welded at an angle and makes the bar for that hand wobble. Also, the welds don't look very good--they're kinda short. Just seems like a cheap job. Anyway, I'll have a replacement in a few days so I can write a proper review. UPDATE: I got a replacement and it's fine. I still think the welds look cheap, though. However, since I'm not an expert I won't deduct anything since it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: e40

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put together and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for!! Easy to put together and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: I use this a lot!
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I do not like is the screw part of the bar ( no matter how tight you tighten it) still loosens itself some!
customer_reviews.author: Charlotte

customer_reviews.title: Satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Only four screws, so as easy to assemble as I could hope for. Sturdy enough for push ups, and taller than most cheapos. Not nearly enough range of motion for good dips but is to be expected with this height
customer_reviews.author: aaron

customer_reviews.title: Quality / manufacturing issues - Loose Bolt
customer_reviews.text: One screw hole was poorly drilled. Now one of the parts is loose and the item isn’t as stable as it should be. Not sure if it is worth the hastle to return but I am not happy with the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: beginr53493

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, great ground clearance
customer_reviews.text: Simply cannot beat the price for what you get. Sturdy, great ground clearance, and light weight. The tolerance where the handles meet the base could be a little better (i.e. the handle sits flush on the base before being tightened) but once it's on you know you can trust it. Very glad I picked these up and didn't go with the $100 sets.
customer_reviews.author: MGK

customer_reviews.title: It's great!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints, this gets the job done and you will feel the burn and see results. Totally reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Ben T. Suster

customer_reviews.title: I regret I bought this
customer_reviews.text: You can get injured by using this if you not putting it somewhere it can stay. Even I put it on a carpet it kept on moving I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Beaubrun

customer_reviews.title: So far, so great!
customer_reviews.text: I'm at around 175 pounds and use these predominantly for push-ups and dips. So far, they've held up great. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Darcie

customer_reviews.title: It was a very good price and the shipping was very fast
customer_reviews.text: I have received my push up bars now and I love them they're great very strong
customer_reviews.author: Charles Decker

customer_reviews.title: If you're debating what push up bars to get look no further.
customer_reviews.text: These are by far the best push up bars I've purchased. It's very easy to assemble no tools required and the box even came with a guide on the work outs you can do with them. The grip makes it comfortable for consistent reps and it's also calisthenics friendly for those who do l-sits and even planches.
customer_reviews.author: George Alba

customer_reviews.title: Could Get 5 Stars If...
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good, however the machined screw was poorly done so the handle wobbles. The screw would not go all the way in. I tried moving the screws to other positions, however one screw seemed stripped so it is not 100% stable. They are pretty good, I use them for push-ups, planches and handstand push-ups.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Austin

customer_reviews.title: Mini-parallel for various exercises that don't require much space below you
customer_reviews.text: These are good for various exercises you might do on parallel bars that don't require as much space below you. The reason I didn't give it 4 stars is because its not quite as sturdy as I'd like. It doesn't seem like it will break or fall apart but the flat parts on the floor can bend since there is only one wing nut holding each one. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: The joints wobble more than we hoped.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. Just keep the screws tight as they tend to loosen and then it's wobbly.
customer_reviews.author: Dedicated Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good bars for the price
customer_reviews.text: Liked the height and the sturdiness, really light and easy to put together. Wish the padding was a little thicker and longer, I have large hands and it makes it a little difficult to hold
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good. The grips slip a little.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty good. They're sturdy but also easy to dismantle if you need to pack them for travel. I found that the grips twist and move in my hand too much when doing tuck swings and L-sits. I removed them and wrapped the bars with bicycle handlebar tape and they perform much better.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary Gittens

customer_reviews.title: No stability issues, the material is strong, but ...
customer_reviews.text: No stability issues, the material is strong, but the legs( part that is on the floor) gets slanted and does not lock into place completely.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: These are great...Fan of Calisthenics...
customer_reviews.text: Love the J/fit Tall 9' Pro Push Up Bar Stand! These are great for all sorts of upper body workouts including some lower body workouts as well. I am a huge fan of Calisthenics and these push-up bars are great for all sorts of body weight workouts, I give these push-up bars 5 stars and no less.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: great quality
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble and the stands are very solid, great quality i'm very happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: SusieSue

customer_reviews.title: The height on these are great for planche
customer_reviews.text: The height on these are great for planche, L-sit,, push-up, and dips training. The grips are very comfortable. The bars feel sturdy and solid (I weigh about 145lbs; no problems). Assembly is very easy. I am very happy that I no longer have to depend on a gym or the bars at the park to train.
customer_reviews.author: Frank K. Huang

customer_reviews.title: Saves My Wrists!
customer_reviews.text: Love these pushup bars. They have saves my wrists! You can also go deep into your pushup. They are lightweight and I can just set them aside when not using.
customer_reviews.author: Your Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Cheap but sturdy and super easy to assemble. I couldn’t be happier
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: GOOD
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price you pay. It is light which is easy to carry.
customer_reviews.author: Abdul Syed

customer_reviews.title: These push-up bars are very sturdy and well-made
customer_reviews.text: These push-up bars are very sturdy and well-made. I have begun using them for parallette training. I'm able to hold L-sits on them without any sense of give. I also like the cushions for my grip. I highly recommend these bars for parallette training!
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: j/fit great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product!! I am 6'04" 200 lbs and these push up bars can handle my weight with ease. I have been using theme for about 1 month now and can't see myself going back to normal push ups. The reason a purchased these push up bars was because i injured my wrist and was unable to do "normal" push ups without feeling pain in my wrist. With the push up bars i can do puh ups without having to flex my wrist. This has made push ups pain free... thanks j/fit!!!
customer_reviews.author: Son Of Dad

customer_reviews.title: We love our Parallettes!
customer_reviews.text: My fiancé and I recently purchased these and couldn’t be happier! The grips are super padded (maybe a little thick if you have small hands), they are super secure and lightweight which makes them easy to travel with!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Durable
customer_reviews.text: Very Sturdy and Durable. It is definitely leaps and bounds better than my original cheap plastic pushup bars. I never realized what I was missing out on until I received this. It has definitely helped me to work on my L-Sits and Full Planche
customer_reviews.author: Qu13tst0rM

customer_reviews.title: Christmas Gift
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my brother. He's into acrobats, 90X, Insanity and and other intense workout out there. He used this in front of use and it was amazing. It holds all his body weight without a problem. He is in seventh heaven.
customer_reviews.author: Sassy & Classy

customer_reviews.title: Love the rubber grips on the feet/legs
customer_reviews.text: Love the rubber grips on the feet/legs. Allows me to use this on wood/laminate floors without the fear that the bars will move. ( I made a set of bars similar to these using PVC pipes; they work great but slide around on wood floors). A great buy for any fitness/yogi/calisthenic people.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good starter, wood is best for the taller stands ...
customer_reviews.text: Good starter, wood is best for the taller stands like these but are expensive, so these'll do for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Sergio E Merino

customer_reviews.title: Nice push up bars.
customer_reviews.text: I use these bars for push ups. I ended up making my own paralette bars which are a little taller so i can do L-sits and work my way into doing planche push ups. The bottoms of these push up bars tend to move a little. It doesn't affect the performance, but it just kind of bothersome.
customer_reviews.author: NVDarkfrog

customer_reviews.title: I could never get a great grip. I saw these and ordered them
customer_reviews.text: These are just what I needed. I was using a Bosu Ball handles for push-ups. I could never get a great grip. I saw these and ordered them. Sometimes the simplest items are the best. They go together in about one minute and work terrific! Don't hesitate to buy them.
customer_reviews.author: NotaryMike

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: This product is amazing for the price! But the customer service is even better! Great product, great customer support, everything you could hope for and more!
customer_reviews.author: Noah

customer_reviews.title: Push up parralets
customer_reviews.text: Very good items to add to your gym equipment, easy to mount and dismount.
customer_reviews.author: Aingeal

customer_reviews.title: Bueno for sure
customer_reviews.text: These are sturdy, and I'm using these for a start to my calisthenics. They're sturdy and the handles are good. I leave these laying around in the middle of my living room so that when I walk by it will entice me to try some new stuff
customer_reviews.author: frank villanueva

customer_reviews.title: Great for getting that deeper range of motion
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product. I used it for my calisthenics workouts, and I've seen great advantages for it. It is pretty good quality and not that expensive
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Just right for P90X
customer_reviews.text: The bars are easily assembled...so much so my three year old was able to put it together. It's great for the P90X routines that me (135 lbs) and my husband (220 lbs) are doing. But, what I like best about them is the the height of the bars that allow for doing dips for your triceps as well as the various push-up positions. The only draw back is that the height can't be adjusted, which if it could would make it a five star product. As far as the P90X routines are concerned it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: J. Samer

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble, however the stilts that hold it up constantly shift no matter how tight you fasten them. They do what they are intended to do though. Overall satisfied with product.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Who doesn’t like a good screw?
customer_reviews.text: First time I’ve ever had to write a review. Received product looks sturdy but I can’t confirm because it’s missing the only thing to need to assemble it, the screws.
customer_reviews.author: Spenser D.

customer_reviews.title: Good for L-sit practice. Maybe use gloves though.
customer_reviews.text: Easily assembled in five minutes and sturdy enough for L-sits. High enough to drop very low in your push-ups for a greater challenge. Not as thick of a bar as a standard parallette though.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for body weight work outs!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are really good parallels, so much better than the old "push up" bars. These are absolutely worth the minimal outlay....they are great for deep push ups, hand stands and launches.
customer_reviews.author: GymBum

customer_reviews.title: Mu husband LOVES these. He is a really big ...
customer_reviews.text: Mu husband LOVES these. He is a really big guy and we were worried that they might not be stable enough however they are.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome! I have been using thsee in my bootcamp ...
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! I have been using thsee in my bootcamp class all week for pushups, dips and different balance type exercises. What a great addition to our little gym!
customer_reviews.author: Ginger

customer_reviews.title: love them
customer_reviews.text: the company is very pleasant to work with! thank you for an amazing product!
customer_reviews.author: Evelyn

customer_reviews.title: I love these bars
customer_reviews.text: I love these bars...it's the perfect height to go in deep for maximum workout on the chest. Highly recommend for the push-up enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: IS

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: These bars are tall enough to work on planche. I do handstands on them and they are very sturdy on a wood floor. Not quite tall enough for dip presses on their own.
customer_reviews.author: J Kohjima

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: Glad I bought this, I'm started doing push up again, this is just the right height from the floor that I can get down to the floor and do push up without actually getting on the floor (bad hips and knee problems). Excellent quality and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn G. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product. Have been using it a lot. Really helps my workout!
customer_reviews.author: marc h. siegel

customer_reviews.title: Cool. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together with my lady hands. I use them for downward dog push-ups, as practice for handstand push-ups. Good grip for practicing planche.
customer_reviews.author: Julianna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and my son loves the bars
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately one of the bars was damaged. I contact J/Fit via email and got a reply within three hours (on the weekend). New part shipped out that day. Easy to assemble and my son loves the bars, he says it is exactly what he needed.
customer_reviews.author: D. M. Gordon

customer_reviews.title: L-sit the night away
customer_reviews.text: Necessary for people over six feet. Some of the tallest push up bars. L-sits with ease!! Very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product to improve my pushup workouts and it has helped considerably with that.
customer_reviews.author: Terence Blue

customer_reviews.title: Great work out tool
customer_reviews.text: Great product in general but if your just starting to working out these are very handy to have and can be used and various ways . Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Dago Velasquez

customer_reviews.title: It works, easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: These are labeled as pushup bars. If you were expecting parallel bars, then you just need to get smarter.
customer_reviews.author: KingJames1800

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel.
customer_reviews.text: I like using these to travel with for my pushups and dipping exercises. They are compact enough to throw in my suitcase yet big enough to get a variety of exercises to challenge my body.
customer_reviews.author: Rey

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid construction
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid construction. It was a little wobbly at first, but adjusting the rubber feet so they are all even and flat and flush to the ground fixed that.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Chan

customer_reviews.title: Great workout equiptment. I love this product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is superb. Easy to put together and great for pushups and even travel. Just take it apart and rebuild. Comes with small screws.
customer_reviews.author: Javier X

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product
customer_reviews.text: I received this product and this is how it came. Very disappointed in the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Rosario Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Good Price
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't recommend for high difficulty moves. Might slip from under you depending on surface.
customer_reviews.author: Phillip

customer_reviews.text: Product is just okay. The metal bars are a little cheap and I question their integrity. I ordered this particular product because it was advertised as tall push up bars as opposed to the ones only a few inches off the ground. Though these are higher than standard push up bars, I am not impressed as to their height. It would be nice if they were higher. The screws that keep it together seem like they are going to loosen on their own at any given minute. These are just average in my opinion, but until they break, I'll make due.
customer_reviews.author: kenny

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, durable and fairly priced!
customer_reviews.text: I use these for calisthenic work outs. They hold my weight well and I'm around 210. Fast shipping and exactly what you want in a seller
customer_reviews.author: Anthony La Tona

customer_reviews.title: Does not stay aligned
customer_reviews.text: Wingnut assembly is not sufficient to keep base aligned.There is still significant play even after tightening down all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the metal used seems pretty sturdy and the foam on the handle feels decent
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this product yet because it did not come with any screws for installation. However, the metal used seems pretty sturdy and the foam on the handle feels decent.
customer_reviews.author: Grace  D

customer_reviews.title: Great for handstand push ups or regular push ups and ...
customer_reviews.text: Stable stands with a little extra clearance. Great for handstand push ups or regular push ups and Chair exercises.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Roan

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good solid pair push up bars,I use them for push ups and hand stands,nice an sturdy
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Large enough to function as parallettes but can also cover all the standard push up bar exercises as well. Very happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: davidbu00

customer_reviews.title: Great Bars
customer_reviews.text: So simple to assemble, and great quality. It was even better than I had expected, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Nazli Takesh

customer_reviews.title: Good for Planche and Hand stand Push ups
customer_reviews.text: I am learning calisthenics , this is good for planche and V sit
customer_reviews.author: Sylapberdi

customer_reviews.title: The price was extemely nice compared to other sites that were charging way more ...
customer_reviews.text: These bars are everything I expected and more. The price was extemely nice compared to other sites that were charging way more than the cost on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Garcia Simpson

customer_reviews.title: but they work fine and I use them often
customer_reviews.text: they are not as stable as I expected, but they work fine and I use them often.
customer_reviews.author: Judith A. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Metal push up bars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and a decent height. I use these primarily for handstand push ups and you have the ability to go very deep with them if you so desire because of their height. Great overall.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: I cannot do advanced calisthenics on them like many other bars of the same size and
customer_reviews.text: I would appreaciate if the base of the stand was not movable. I cannot do advanced calisthenics on them like many other bars of the same size and height
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pads on Handles could be bigger
customer_reviews.text: The Bar is strong and works great, the oads on the handle should be wider, they seem to be made for female hands
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Turner

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boyfriend, pretty cheap for the use and durability. He uses it often, I like this a lot

product_meta.title: JFIT j/fit Pro Push Up Bar Stand | Durable Metal Fitness Equipment and Padded Handles for Secure Grip Non Skid Feet Elevated Bar for Enhanced Push Ups
feature_bullets: ENHANCE YOUR PUSH UPS: Our push up bar is the ultimate fitness gear to enhance your push ups and improve whole body posture. The padded handles will provide secure grip for safe push ups!
DURABLE ELEVATED PUSH UP BAR: This tall 9″ pro push up bar is made from durable metal and we can assure you that it will withstand all of your heavy-duty training routines and push up challenges.
NON-SKID FEET FOR SUPERIOR SAFETY: Keep perfect form while doing your push ups with this non-skid push up bar. The anti-slip feet will keep the push up stand right where it belongs without sliding.
MINIMUM ASSEMBLY PUSH UP BAR: Voted as the best mid-range push up bar by wiki.ezvid and top 10 of all push up bars for 2016! Very limited assembly, only 2 locking screws and no tools needed!
NO MORE WRIST PAINS: J/fit push up bar is designed in a way so as to offer your great range of motion without straining your wrists, unlike other push up bars. Minimize pain and skyrocket workouts.
